Getting the actually rich to pay is not easy as they are mobile but that is a whole another story.

post_title: How poverty rate is higher among immigrants if immigration requires proof of funds/income?

Poverty rates for foreign born people are similar by tenure to UK born people, but higher for social renters than owner occupiers.

post_title: Millions of workers to be dragged into 40pc income tax band. ‘Fiscal drag’ phenomenon will also mean a further four million on relatively low incomes will be captured by tax system.
comment_body: The government have also made no attempt to fix the 5060k cliff edge for parents, and the 60 marginal rate that applies on incomes between 100 and 120k.
comment_argument: government is not doing something correct to fix this
llm_argument: the comment criticizes the governments failure to address related tax issues  the 5060k cliff edge for parents and the high marginal rate for incomes between 100120k  suggesting the titles focus on income tax bands is incomplete and doesnt represent a comprehensive fiscal policy

post_title: Lowest graduate salaries ‘on a par with minimum wage’ - The shrinking pay gap raises fears that university may be a waste of money for many students and could turn disaffected young people towards political extremes
comment_body: The other side to this was a downplaying of traditional apprenticeship routes towards achieving a fulfilling career. New Labours Education Education Education policy inevitably devalued apprenticeships, contributing to the housing crisis via increased construction costs. University became merely an extension of 6th form and degrees were subsequently devalued forcing graduates to chase a questionable masters degree or PhD in order to distinguish themselves. Nearly all sweeping centralised policies like this lead to unforeseen consequences.
comment_argument: the university system is the other reason causing this
llm_argument: the comment argues that new labours education policies specifically devaluing apprenticeships are a key factor in the graduate salary issue suggesting universitys role is being misrepresented and that alternative pathways were undermined
